DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for skin melanoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma._Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients._One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma
Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.longName: Clinical
Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

Concepts.longName: M Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/9/18 tt moved to NCI Standards Context. Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Clinical M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma cM1d(1) TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma cM1d(1) TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with distant metastasis to CNS with or without M1a, M1b, or M1c sites of disease.  LDH level elevated. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma cM1d(1) TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with distant metastasis to CNS with or without M1a, M1b, or M1c sites of disease.  LDH level elevated. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma cM1d(0) TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma cM1d(0) TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with distant metastasis to CNS with or without M1a, M1b, or M1c sites of disease.  LDH level normal. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma cM1d(0) TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with distant metastasis to CNS with or without M1a, M1b, or M1c sites of disease.  LDH level normal. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma cM1d TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with distant metastasis to CNS with or without M1a, M1b, or M1c sites of disease.  LDH level not recorded or unspecified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma cM1d TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with distant metastasis to CNS with or without M1a, M1b, or M1c sites of disease.  LDH level not recorded or unspecified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with distant metastasis to non-CNS visceral sites with or without M1a or M1b sites of disease.  LDH level elevated. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with distant metastasis to non-CNS visceral sites with or without M1a or M1b sites of disease.  LDH level not recorded or unspecified. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
